summary:
Right from the beginning of my career I have have been involved in many engineering projects that started in the conceptual phase. 
I have always felt comfortable with this type of activities, but over the years I also gained much experience in detailed engineering and managing projects and managing people.

My engineering experience spreads from small consumer goods (plastic coffee cups for Douwe Egberts) to heavy industrial equipment (a 2 MegaWatt windturbine at EWT, Amersfoort), and from small product series (i.e.bearing test rigs at SKF Engineering & Research Centre in Nieuwegein, or a 30 tonnes board crane at IHC, Sliedrecht) to products that are produced at a staggering number of 80.000 pieces per day(!) at Mirror Controls International (MCi) in Montfoort (formerly: Eaton Automotive).

Over the years I have been strongly active in the following areas of engineering:
- Renewables / Wind industry
- Heavy industrial equipment
- Automotive industry
- Medical equipment

My experience in various areas of engineering enables me to effectively introduce, for instance, design solutions, materials or techniques that are new to a product area or a manufacturer, but are 'common practice' in other areas of engineering.

This diversity of projects also leads to a wide variety of company types that I have worked with. One of the great challenges is to always quickly adapt to a project team or company or to a specific methodology (like 'Design for 6-Sigma') and of course to quickly understand a product and to find out how a product can most effectively be improved.

I am aware of the fact that a good idea is not valued unless it is presented in the right manner, so I always pay much attention to the presentation of any result.

I really this field of work and I like to be constantly expanding my horizon.

Erik Verdegaal

profile_positions.description:
My activities for EWT cover or have covered the following:

Development project of a 2 MegaWatt windturbine 
(Hub height: 85m; Rotor diameter: 90/96m)
My roles/responsibilities for this project:
-Development team leader
-Chief mechanical engineer
-External communication
-Supplier assessment (EU/China)
-Prototype construction supervision (China)
-Assembly line setup (China)
-Certification documentation preparation

Value engineering activities and concept development:
- Value engineering or installation improvements
- Concept development for alternative (Direct drive) generator cooling systems, 
- Generator design: alternative drive trains and alternative bearing arrangements

Analysis/Simulation activities:
- Involvement in FEM analysis of turbine components and related design optimizations
- Involvement in generator temperature behavior analysis and related design optimizations
- Involvement in processing of load case data
- Supplier visits / assessing production facilities and quality of potential suppliers

Improving technical documentation:
- I was asked to develop an 'easy to understand' installation manual in order to have the opportunity to outsource turbine installation work
- In the same line  have created a more graphical method of writing instructions for the factory assembly activities of our products

Works council membership:
- Due to rapid growth of EWT, a works council became mandatory for EWT in 2013 and I have been involved in the preparation process for establishing such a council.
I was elected in the subsequent elections and I am active a works council member from February 2014
